# Data process



## Cuba


### Wave 1


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `PALCNOW`|`PALCPAST`|
|-|-|-|
| **Label** | `alcohol - units drunk per week now`<br/>`1 unit = a small glass of beer = a single measure of spirits = 1 glass of wine or sherry`<br/>`32 units = 1 bottle of spirits`|`alcohol - units drunk per week before age of 65 years`<br/>`1 unit = a small glass of beer = a single measure of spirits = 1 glass of wine or sherry`<br/>`32 units = 1 bottle of spirits`|
| **Table name**  | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` | `1066-Cuba-Baseline` |
| **Categories** | `continuous` | `continuous` |
| **Missings** | `NA` | `NA` |
| **Description** |  |  |

```{r assign cuba_w1, echo=F}

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 't1066_cuba_w1','10-66.1066-Cuba-Baseline',variables=list('PALCNOW','PALCPAST'), missings = T)
t1066_cuba_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'t1066_cuba_w1')

```

```{r local cuba_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$PALCNOW
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = 'PALCNOW')
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1, aes(PALCNOW)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(-1,35)

vbl <- t1066_cuba_w1$PALCPAST
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = NA)[3], caption = 'PALCPAST')
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = NA)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(t1066_cuba_w1, aes(PALCPAST)) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")+xlim(-1,35)


```


#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `current_oh` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PALCNOW == 0 into 0`
* `PALCNOW > 0 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `freq_oh` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `If PALCNOW=0 then 'drinking_frequency'=0`
* `if PALCNOW=1 or 2 then 'drinking_frequency'=1`
* `if PALCNOW>2 then 'drinking_frequency'=2`

To compute `past_oh` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `PALCPAST == 0 into 0`
* `PALCPAST > 0 into 1`
* `NA into 999`


<!--
# Two options One is using the same algorithm that for current_oh:
#
# The second option, as provided by the template and explicited below:
* `since PALCPAST is a continuous variable we characterise as past drinkers those people being Q2, Q3, Q4 quantile of its distribution and as non past drinkers those being in the lowest Q1`
Q <- quantile(t1066_cuba_w1$PALCPAST, probs = 1/4, na.rm = TRUE, names = FALSE)
t1066_cuba_w1$past_oh <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1$PALCPAST, "0:Q=0; (Q+1):hi=1; NA=999")

-->


**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w1}

t1066_ds_cuba_w1 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w1$id)
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$freq_oh <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1$PALCNOW, "0 = 0; c(1,2) = 1; 3:hi = 2; NA = 999")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$current_oh <- car::recode(t1066_ds_cuba_w1$freq_oh, "2 = 1")
t1066_ds_cuba_w1$past_oh <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w1$PALCPAST, "0 = 0; 1:hi = 1; NA = 999")

```


#### Statistics of the new harmonized variable

```{r descript cuba_w1, echo=F}

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$current_oh
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_curr)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(current_oh))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_curr) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$freq_oh
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_freq)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(freq_oh))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_freq) + ylab("Frequency")

vbl <- t1066_ds_cuba_w1$past_oh
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label_past)
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[1], caption = "Category")
kable(Categorical_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Type of missing")
ggplot(t1066_ds_cuba_w1, aes(x=factor(past_oh))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label_past) + ylab("Frequency")

```


#### Validation

```{r crosstabulation cuba_w1, echo=F}

```



### Wave 2


#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `f_PALCPAST`|

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `current_oh` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `f_PALCPAST == 0 into 0`
* `f_PALCPAST > 0 into 1`
* `NA into 999`

To compute `freq_oh` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `If f_PALCPAST=0 then 'drinking_frequency'=0`
* `if f_PALCPAST=1 or 2 then 'drinking_frequency'=1`
* `if f_PALCPAST>2 then 'drinking_frequency'=2`

To compute `past_oh` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* `take from wave 1`


**R script:**

```{r harmo cuba_w2}

t1066_ds_cuba_w2 <- tibble(id=t1066_cuba_w2$id)

t1066_ds_cuba_w2$freq_oh <- car::recode(t1066_cuba_w2$f_PALCPAST, "0 = 0; c(1,2) = 1; 3:hi = 2; NA = 999")

t1066_cuba_w2 <- left_join(t1066_cuba_w2,t1066_ds_cuba_w1,by="id")
t1066_ds_cuba_w2$past_oh <- t1066_cuba_w2$past_oh

```

# Quality estimation

* To harmonize `past_oh` we assign `0` to `0` and higher values to `1`, instead of using quantiles, as the algorithm was previously proposed, since the frequency of the `0` value is always around 80%.
* It was recommended to use the variables `PALCPAST` and `PALCNOW` instead of the variables `ALCNOW` and `ALCPAST` because of the high number of missing values in the last two. 
* In the followup waves the variable corresponding to `PALCNOW` is `f_PALCPAST`. In fact, in the questionnaire, it appears associated to the question `In the last week how much did you drink? (Record maximum regular consumption in UNITS of alcohol per week)` (not as the labels of the datasets seem to indicate). Therefore, we harmonize the current alcohol drinking of followup waves with `f_PALCPAST`, while the past drinking had already been asked in baseline waves (since the population was already greater than 65 years old), so it is used that information.
